info.name: coreSync_admin_service_API
info.description:
# Admin API Documentation

## Overview

The Admin API provides comprehensive administrative functionality for the ERP system, including user management, authentication, notifications, address management, roles and permissions, and system configuration.

## Getting Started

### Authentication

This API uses Bearer token authentication. Include your authentication token in the Authorization header:

```
Authorization: Bearer {{vault:bearerToken}}

 ```

### Base URL

Set the `{{base_url}}` variable in your environment to point to your API server (e.g., `http://localhost:8080`).

## API Modules

### üîê Authentication (Auth)

Handles user authentication and session management.

- Login and logout operations
    
- Token management
    
- Session validation
    

### üë• User Management

Complete user lifecycle management including:

- Create, read, update, and delete users
    
- User profile management
    
- User status management
    

### üìç Address & Location

Manage addresses and location data:

- Address CRUD operations
    
- City and district lookups
    
- Location hierarchy management
    

### üîë Roles & Permissions

Role-based access control (RBAC) system:

- Role creation and management
    
- Permission assignment
    
- Role-permission mapping
    

### üîî Notifications

Notification system management:

- Create and manage notifications
    
- Notification type configuration
    
- Notification delivery tracking
    

### ‚öôÔ∏è System Configuration

System-level settings and preferences:

- SMTP settings for email delivery
    
- System preferences
    
- Organization settings
    

## Common Workflows

### Setting Up a New User

1. Create user account (User ‚Üí Create user)
    
2. Assign role (Role ‚Üí Assign role to user)
    
3. Configure permissions (Permission ‚Üí Set permissions)
    
4. Create address if needed (Address ‚Üí Create address)
    

### Configuring Notifications

1. Create notification type (Notification ‚Üí Create notification type)
    
2. Configure SMTP settings (SmtpSettings ‚Üí Configure SMTP)
    
3. Send notifications (Notification ‚Üí Create notification)
    

## Environment Variables

Ensure these variables are configured in your environment:

- `base_url` - Your API server URL
    
- `vault:bearerToken` - Your authentication token (stored securely in Postman Vault)
    

## Support & Resources

For additional support or to report issues, contact your system administrator or development team.

---

_Last updated: 2024_
